meanings.sent1: After the wildfire, the forest is slowly repopulating with new trees.
meanings.sent2: The farmers are repopulating the fields with fresh crops for the next season.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnomes are having a meeting about repopulating the flower beds with colorful blooms.
meanings.sent4: The library shelves are eagerly awaiting new books to repopulate their empty spaces.
meanings.sent5: The children are excitedly repopulating their sandcastle village after the tide washed it away.

meanings.definition: The act of repopulating an area.
meanings.sent1: The repopulating of the national park brought back many wildlife species.
meanings.sent2: The repopulating of the city after the war was a slow but steady process.
meanings.sent3: The repopulating of the office fridge with fresh lunches caused a lot of excitement among the employees.
meanings.sent4: The repopulating of the aquarium with colorful fish created a mesmerizing underwater world.
meanings.sent5: The repopulating of the school playground with children's laughter filled the air with joy.

meanings.definition: The process of increasing the population of a species in a certain area.
meanings.sent1: The repopulating of the endangered species in the reserve was a conservation success.
meanings.sent2: The repopulating of the river with fish boosted the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The repopulating of the toy store with new plush animals made the shelves look lively again.
meanings.sent4: The repopulating of the garden with buzzing bees brought life and color to the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The repopulating of the park with chirping birds created a harmonious natural symphony.
